message_1: If the Caesar cipher shifts each letter of a message by 4 places to the right, what is the encrypted code for the message "MATHEMATICS"?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using a Caesar cipher with a shift of 4, we will shift each letter 4 positions to the right in the alphabet. If a letter goes beyond 'Z', it wraps around to the beginning of the alphabet. Here's the encrypted message:

M -> Q
A -> E
T -> X
H -> L
E -> I
M -> Q
A -> E
T -> X
I -> M
C -> G
S -> W

So, the encrypted code for the message "MATHEMATICS" is "QEXLQEXMIGW".
